dashboard.haveFeedbackContent: Let us know what’s on your mind to improve Manage for you.

faq.question1: How accurate is the data in Sway?
faq.answer1: Sway's data is only as accurate as the commercial data sources it is powered by. As it isn't Serai's own, there may be errors, or the data may be incomplete - commercial data sources always have this! Please bear this in mind when making decisions from the data. In the future we'll have features that allow users to correct the data, making that Serai data - the single point of truth on trade for everyone.
faq.question2: How much data does Sway have?
faq.answer2: Currently, Sway uses only sample datasets. The Data Team has built technology to stitch it all together and to make it available. Now that we've done this, soon we'll introduce much larger datasets that cover millions of companies globally. For now, Sway's sample data is from 2018, and only covers a small part of global trade.
faq.question3: Can I request new types of data to be added to Sway?
faq.answer3c: and ask for the datasets you need.
faq.question4: What sort of search terms can I use?
faq.answer4: For now, Sway uses full-word searches, such as “Ralph” or “Cotton”. Partial-word searches, such as “Ral” or “Cot” won’t give you results yet. Partial-word searches are planned for future versions of Sway.
faq.answer5: Great question. This is a score showing how strongly companies are connected to across all of our data, on a scale of 0 to 1. This is a score determined by the sum of USD of trade between companies. The higher the number, the stronger the connection between two companies, relative to all connections that exist in Sway.
